etymology.description: 門(門) (mén, "gate") + 官(官) (guān, "official") = official on gate -> watchtower
etymology.interpretation: 䦕(䦕) (guān, "watchtower") combines 門(門) (mén, "gate") to indicate a structure and 官(官) (guān, "official") to suggest oversight, creating the idea of a watchtower.

examples.chinese: 古城的边缘建有一座坚固的䦕(古城的邊緣建有一座堅固的䦕)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔchéng de biānyuán jiàn yǒu yī zuò jiāngù de guān.
examples.english: A sturdy watchtower was built at the edge of the ancient city.

examples.chinese: 傍晚时分(傍晚時分)，守卫登上了高处的䦕(守衛登上了高處的䦕)。
examples.pinyin: Bàngwǎn shífēn, shǒuwèi dēng shàngle gāochù de guān.
examples.english: In the evening, the guards ascended the high watchtower.
